commitMessage:
@@@[CALCITE-3252] Add CONVERT_TIMEZONE.  TO_DATE and TO_TIMESTAMP non-standard functions (Lindsey Meyer)

CONVERT_TIMEZONE is for Redshift; TO_DATE and TO_TIMESTAMP are for
PostgreSQL (including Redshift) and Oracle.

Close apache/calcite#1380

@@@[CALCITE-2302] Implicit type cast support

Changes:
* Support full implicit type coercion for SQL contexts:
Set operation.  binary arithmetic exprs.  binary equality
exprs.  binary comparison exprs.  case when(COALESCE). 
IN operation.  builtin functions.  user defined function(UDF);
* The SqlValidator now takes a component named `TypeCoercion`
responsible for the coercion work.  you can turn off the coercion with
`SqlValidator#setEnableTypeCoercion(false)`;
* We follow PostgreSQL and SQL-SERVER conversion style for two integers division. 
i.e. `'9'/2` returns INTEGER 4.

@@@[CALCITE-3327] Simplify SqlValidatorTest and SqlParserTest by making test methods fluent

Replace 'boolean typeCoercion' parameter with fluent method 'Sql.withTypeCoercion(boolean)'.

Deprecate various checkXxx methods. For example. 
checkExp(sql.  expected) becomes expr(sql).ok();
checkExpFails(sql.  e) becomes expr(s).fails(e).

Rename SqlParserTest.exp to expr.

@@@[CALCITE-3892] Make junit test classes and methods non-public where possible

Prior to junit 5.  classes and methods had to be public. This is no
longer the case.

Some classes need to remain public because they are referenced from
elsewhere.  or if they use reflection somehow. The remaining 'public'
keyword will be informative to maintainers.

@@@Refactor SqlToRelTestBase to allow custom Context in tests

In particular.  allows a RelOptRulesTest to use a custom
operator table.
